title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages have been installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Bar Chart

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Dotplot

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(binwidth = 2.5,
               dotsize = 0.5) +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, 
                     breaks = NULL)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Histogram

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 color = "black",
                 fill = "pink")





ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS,
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 color = "black")

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Kernel Density Estimate

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_density()





ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, 
           colour = GENDER)) +
  geom_density()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Boxplot

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot()





ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot(notch = TRUE)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Boxplot + Point

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(position = "jitter",
             size = 0.5)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Violin

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_violin()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Violin + Boxplot

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_violin(fill = "light yellow") +
  geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.5)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Scatter Plot (Point)

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Best Fit Curve

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(size = 0.5)

Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.


`geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Best Fit Line

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, size = 0.5)

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: ISSS608 Visual Analytics & Applications
text: Welcome to my website for ISSS608 Visual Analytics & Applications (Jan 2023 term). This is part of my coursework for the Masters of IT in Business (Analytics Track) at Singapore Management University.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Trellis Plot (Facet)

ggplot(data = exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20) +
    facet_wrap(~ CLASS)





ggplot(data = exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20) +
    facet_grid(~ CLASS)





ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = CLASS)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  facet_grid(~ GENDER)





ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = CLASS)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  facet_grid(GENDER ~.)





ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  facet_grid(GENDER ~ CLASS)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Working with Coordinates

ggplot(data = exam_data, 
       aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip()




Aligning x-axis and y-axis ranges:

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = lm,
              size = 0.5) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100),
                  ylim = c(0,100))

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Working with Themes
A list of themes can be found at this link

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_gray()





ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_classic()





ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal()





ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_gray() +
  theme(panel.background = element_rect(
    fill = "light blue",
    colour = "light blue",
    linewidth = 0.5,
    linetype = "solid"),
    panel.grid.major = element_line(
      linewidth = 0.5,
      linetype = "solid",
      colour = "white"),
    panel.grid.minor = element_line(
      linewidth = 0.25,
      linetype = "solid",
      colour = "white"))

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Makeover 1





Issues with the bar chart:

y-axis (count) is not clear
the bars should be sorted by frequency
frequency values should be indicated for clarity


ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=reorder(RACE,RACE,
                function(x)-length(x))))+
  geom_bar() +
  ylim(0,220) +
  geom_text(stat="count", 
      aes(label=paste0(after_stat(count), ", ", 
      round(after_stat(count)/sum(after_stat(count))*100,
            1), "%")),
      vjust=-1) +
  xlab("Race") +
  ylab("No. of\nPupils") +
  theme(axis.title.y=element_text(angle = 0))





exam_data %>%
  mutate(RACE = fct_infreq(RACE)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = RACE)) + 
  geom_bar()+
  ylim(0,220) +
  geom_text(stat="count", 
      aes(label=paste0(after_stat(count), ", ", 
      round(after_stat(count)/sum(after_stat(count))*100,
            1), "%")),
      vjust=-1) +
  xlab("Race") +
  ylab("No. of\nPupils") +
  theme(axis.title.y=element_text(angle = 0))

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Makeover 2





Issues with the histogram:

bins are not clear
add mean and median lines


ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 colour = "black",
                 fill = "light yellow") +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept = mean(MATHS, na.rm = T)),
             colour = "red",
             linetype = "dashed",
             size = 1) +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept = median(MATHS, na.rm = T)),
             colour = "purple",
             linetype = "dashed",
             size = 1)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Makeover 3
Creating a background histogram for total distribution within a facet wrap for two categories

d <- exam_data   
d_bg <- d[, -3]  

ggplot(d, aes(x = ENGLISH, fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(data = d_bg, bins = 20, fill = "grey", alpha = .5) +
  geom_histogram(bins =20, colour = "black") +
  facet_wrap(~ GENDER) +
  guides(fill = "none") +  
  theme_bw()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Makeover 4
Create intercept grids and aligning x-axis and y-axis for a scatterplot

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  geom_hline(yintercept=50,
             linetype="dashed",
             color="grey60",
             size=1) + 
  geom_vline(xintercept=50, 
             linetype="dashed",
             color="grey60",
             size=1)
